Subjective: Headache for ~2 months; worsening in frequency from sporadic to weekly. Location: primarily Right side, sometimes diffuse. Duration: lasts for a few days, simmers, then subsides. Associated with nausea (at worst), visual glare, photophobia (prefers dark room), and phonophobia (worse when people talk). No vomiting, no flashes of light. No recent stress; onset during vacation. Impact: unable to play volleyball or socialize with friends. Tried paracetamol and ibuprofen with some relief. FHx: Father with migraines, grandfather with cluster headaches. No family hx of tumors. Social: 20 y/o male medical student. No smoking, drugs, coffee, or energy drinks. Occasional alcohol (2-3 beers per sitting). Exercises regularly (gym 4x/week, running, cycling). Request: Wants to know if this is migraine vs. cluster headache and how to manage it.
Objective: Vitals: BP 120/80, Pulse 50 bpm (steady). Neuro Exam: Cranial nerves intact. Finger-nose test good. Strength good in arms and legs. Romberg's normal. Gait: Tandem walk slightly off but manageable.
Assessment: Suspected Migraine. Cluster headache less likely. No red flag signs noted.
Plan: Patient education: Advised to read about migraine on thuisarts.nl.
Medication: Start pain relief immediately at symptom onset. First-line Paracetamol (up to 4x two tablets). May add Ibuprofen if insufficient.
Monitoring: Keep a headache diary to identify patterns and triggers.
Follow-up: Return in 4 weeks to review diary and evaluate.
Safety Netting: Return sooner if symptoms worsen significantly or change.
